byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Anatolian News Agency reports that Turkish authorities have arrested 21 men suspected of belonging to Islamic State group, including three foreigners; Turkey has been urged by its Western allies to take more active role in fight against Islamic extremists.
lead_paragraph: In early morning raids Friday in Istanbul and Sanliurfa Province, which borders Syria, the police also seized automatic rifles, ammunition and military uniforms.

headline.main: Turkey Arrests 21 Suspected of Ties to ISIS
headline.print_headline: Turkey Arrests 21 Suspected of Ties to ISIS

snippet: In early morning raids Friday in Istanbul and Sanliurfa Province, which borders Syria, the police also seized automatic rifles, ammunition and military uniforms.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
